column1: Topic title: BREAKING terrorist storms school  takes hostages

column8: text

column7: From: Somewhere in the pacific, or indian ocean
column8: Islamist militants storm school in southern Philippines, take students hostageMANILA (Reuters) - Pro-Islamic State militants stormed a school in the southern Philippines early on Wednesday and are holding several students hostage, police said, on the same island where fighting between government troops and Islamists has entered its fifth week.A police report said about 300 armed men, among them members of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF), stormed a school in Pigcawayan town in North Cotabato province on Mindanao island and were holding some students captive. (For a graphic map of the region click: http://reut.rs/2sRQNAF)Members of the BIFF were engaged in a gunbattle with the military, Chief Inspector Realan Mamon, the police chief at Pigcawayan, said in a radio interview."We can confirm that they occupied a school and there were civilians trapped. We are in the process of determining how many were trapped and their identities," Mamon said.Read more at http://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2017/...cmWvkUIf8Xmd.99looks like it ended "peacefully"??
